verses.verse: Why, seeing times <S%H6256><s%> are not hidden <S%H6845><s%> <S%H8738><s%> from 'El SHaddai <S%H7706><s%>, do they that know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8802><s%> him not see <S%H2372><s%> <S%H8804><s%> his days <S%H3117><s%> ?
Some remove <S%H5381><s%> <S%H8686><s%> the landmarks <S%H1367><s%>; they violently take away <S%H1497><s%> <S%H8804><s%> flocks <S%H5739><s%>, and feed <S%H7462><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thereof.

They drive away <S%H5090><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the ass <S%H2543><s%> of the fatherless <S%H3490><s%>, they take <S%H2254><s%> the widow's <S%H490><s%> ox <S%H7794><s%> for a pledge <S%H2254><s%> <S%H8799><s%>.

They turn <S%H5186><s%> <S%H8686><s%> the needy <S%H34><s%> out of the way <S%H1870><s%>: the poor <S%H6041><s%> <S%H8675><s%> <S%H6035><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> hide <S%H2244><s%> <S%H8795><s%> themselves together <S%H3162><s%>.

Behold, as wild asses <S%H6501><s%> in the desert <S%H4057><s%>, go they forth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8804><s%> to their work <S%H6467><s%>; rising betimes <S%H7836><s%> <S%H8764><s%> for a prey <S%H2964><s%>: the wilderness <S%H6160><s%> yieldeth food <S%H3899><s%> for them and for their children <S%H5288><s%>.

They reap <S%H7114><s%> <S%H8799><s%> <S%H8675><s%> <S%H7114><s%> <S%H8686><s%> every one his corn <S%H1098><s%> in the field <S%H7704><s%>: and they gather <S%H3953><s%> <S%H8762><s%> the vintage <S%H3754><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>.
They cause the naked <S%H6174><s%> to lodge <S%H3885><s%> <S%H8686><s%> without clothing <S%H3830><s%>, that they have no covering <S%H3682><s%> in the cold <S%H7135><s%>.

They are wet <S%H7372><s%> <S%H8799><s%> with the showers <S%H2230><s%> of the mountains <S%H2022><s%>, and embrace <S%H2263><s%> <S%H8765><s%> the rock <S%H6697><s%> for want of a shelter <S%H4268><s%>.
They pluck <S%H1497><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the fatherless <S%H3490><s%> from the breast <S%H7699><s%>, and take a pledge <S%H2254><s%> <S%H8799><s%> of the poor <S%H6041><s%>.

They cause him to go <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8765><s%> naked <S%H6174><s%> without clothing <S%H3830><s%>, and they take away <S%H5375><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the sheaf <S%H6016><s%> from the hungry <S%H7457><s%>;

Which make oil <S%H6671><s%> <S%H8686><s%> within <S%H996><s%> their walls <S%H7791><s%>, and tread <S%H1869><s%> <S%H8804><s%> their winepresses <S%H3342><s%>, and suffer thirst <S%H6770><s%> <S%H8799><s%>.

Men <S%H4962><s%> groan <S%H5008><s%> <S%H8799><s%> from out of the city <S%H5892><s%>, and the soul <S%H5315><s%> of the wounded <S%H2491><s%> crieth out <S%H7768><s%> <S%H8762><s%>: yet 'Elohim <S%H433><s%> layeth <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not folly <S%H8604><s%> to them.

They are of those that rebel <S%H4775><s%> <S%H8802><s%> against the light <S%H216><s%>; they know <S%H5234><s%> <S%H8689><s%> not the ways <S%H1870><s%> thereof, nor abide <S%H3427><s%> <S%H8804><s%> in the paths <S%H5410><s%> thereof.

The murderer <S%H7523><s%> <S%H8802><s%> rising <S%H6965><s%> <S%H8799><s%> with the light <S%H216><s%> killeth <S%H6991><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> and needy <S%H34><s%>, and in the night <S%H3915><s%> is as a thief <S%H1590><s%>.

The eye <S%H5869><s%> also of the adulterer <S%H5003><s%> <S%H8802><s%> waiteth <S%H8104><s%> <S%H8804><s%> for the twilight <S%H5399><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%> <S%H8800><s%>, No eye <S%H5869><s%> shall see <S%H7789><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me: and disguiseht <S%H5643><s%> <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8799><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%>.

In the dark <S%H2822><s%> they dig through <S%H2864><s%> <S%H8804><s%> houses <S%H1004><s%>, which they had marked <S%H2856><s%> <S%H8765><s%> for themselves in the daytime <S%H3119><s%>: they know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8804><s%> not the light <S%H216><s%>.

For the morning <S%H1242><s%> is to them even as <S%H3162><s%> the shadow of death <S%H6757><s%>: if one know <S%H5234><s%> <S%H8686><s%> them, they are in the terrors <S%H1091><s%> of the shadow of death <S%H6757><s%>.

He is swift <S%H7031><s%> as the waters <S%H6440><s%> <S%H4325><s%>; their portion <S%H2513><s%> is cursed <S%H7043><s%> <S%H8792><s%> in the earth <S%H776><s%>: he beholdeth <S%H6437><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not the way <S%H1870><s%> of the vineyards <S%H3754><s%>.

Drought <S%H6723><s%> and heat <S%H2527><s%> consume <S%H1497><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the snow <S%H7950><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%>: so doth the grave <S%H7585><s%> those which have sinned <S%H2398><s%> <S%H8804><s%>.

The womb <S%H7358><s%> shall forget <S%H7911><s%> <S%H8799><s%> him; the worm <S%H7415><s%> shall feed sweetly <S%H4988><s%> <S%H8804><s%> on him; he shall be no more remembered <S%H2142><s%> <S%H8735><s%>; and wickedness <S%H5766><s%> shall be broken <S%H7665><s%> <S%H8735><s%> as a tree <S%H6086><s%>.
He evil entreateth <S%H7462><s%> <S%H8802><s%> the barren <S%H6135><s%> that beareth <S%H3205><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not: and doeth not good <S%H3190><s%> <S%H8686><s%> to the widow <S%H490><s%>.

He draweth <S%H4900><s%> <S%H8804><s%> also the mighty <S%H47><s%> with his power <S%H3581><s%>: he riseht up <S%H6965><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and no man is sure <S%H539><s%> <S%H8686><s%> of life <S%H2416><s%>.
Though it be given <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> him to be in safety <S%H983><s%>, whereon he resteth <S%H8172><s%> <S%H8735><s%>; yet his eyes <S%H5869><s%> are upon their ways <S%H1870><s%>.

They are exalted <S%H7426><s%> <S%H8804><s%> for a little while <S%H4592><s%>, but are gone and brought low <S%H4355><s%> <S%H8717><s%>; they are taken out <S%H7092><s%> <S%H8735><s%> of the way <S%H1870><s%> as all other, and cut off <S%H5243><s%> <S%H8799><s%> as the tops <S%H7218><s%> of the ears of corn <S%H7641><s%>.

And if it be not so now <S%H645><s%>, who will make <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me a liar <S%H3576><s%> <S%H8686><s%>, and make <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8799><s%> my speech <S%H4405><s%> nothing worth <S%H408><s%> ?
